**Statement**

I believe that the establishment of lofty ideals should follow personal hobbies. When we pursue our passions, we are more likely to be motivated and persistent. We are also more likely to make a meaningful contribution to the world.

Here are some of the reasons why I believe that lofty ideals should follow personal hobbies:

* **Personal hobbies are a source of passion and motivation.** When we are passionate about something, we are more likely to put in the hard work and dedication required to achieve our goals. This is especially important when working towards lofty ideals, which can be challenging and time-consuming.
* **Personal hobbies allow us to develop our unique skills and talents.** Everyone has different strengths and weaknesses. When we pursue our hobbies, we have the opportunity to develop our unique skills and talents. This can help us to make a unique and valuable contribution to the world.
* **Personal hobbies can connect us to others who share our values and interests.** When we participate in our hobbies, we have the opportunity to meet and connect with other people who share our values and interests. This can provide us with a sense of community and support, which can be important when working towards lofty ideals.

Of course, not all personal hobbies can be turned into lofty ideals. However, I believe that everyone has at least one hobby that has the potential to be turned into a lofty ideal. For example, if you are passionate about music, you could set a goal of using your music to inspire and uplift others. If you are passionate about social justice, you could set a goal of using your skills and talents to make a positive difference in the world.

**Conclusion**

In conclusion, I believe that the establishment of lofty ideals should follow personal hobbies. When we pursue our passions, we are more likely to be motivated and persistent. We are also more likely to make a meaningful contribution to the world.
